revised_title: Alfred James Ewart: A Pioneering Botanist and Systematic Biologist
tldr: Alfred James Ewart was a prominent British botanist and plant physiologist who made significant contributions to the field of botany in Australia. He conducted research on various aspects of plant physiology, including the ascent of water in trees, and played a crucial role in developing the botanical department at the University of Melbourne. Ewart also made important contributions to systematic botany, authoring the standard work on the flora of Victoria. In addition, he was involved in solving local economic problems and played a significant part in the development of forestry in Victoria.
